item.title: Skinwalker vs Wendigo | Missing 411 | Podcast Episode 67
item.description: One of the most common questions we receive here at The Lore Lodge: what is the difference between a Wendigo and a Skinwalker? Well, we decided to answer that for you. The short version? A Skinwalker is a Native American shaman who practices bad medicine (magic), while a Wendigo is human transformed into a monster by demonic energy or entities. To learn more...watch the podcast. item.title: A Man Vanished from Mt. Marathon | Missing 411 | Podcast Episode 64
item.description: Every year on July 4th, the town of Seward, Alaska, comes together to watch nearly 1000 brave men and women ascend Mt. Marathon in a grueling wilderness race. Racers can expect anything from mild scrapes and bruises all the way to broken bones, but in 2012, disaster struck. Paul Michael LeMaitre went up...but he didn't come down. What happened to him? item.title: Strange Disappearances in Yosemite | Missing 411 | Podcast Episode 62
item.description: Home to beautiful scenery, natural wonders, and countless hiking trails, Yosemite National Park is also known for something much darker: the unsolved disappearances of numerous people. From a mystery body discovered in the 60's to the disappearances of teenaged Stacy Arras and hiker Timothy Barnes in the 1980's, this national treasure seems to be hiding a concerning secret. item.title: The Valley of Headless Men | Missing 411 | Podcast Episode 60
item.description: For over a century, strange disappearances and grisly murders have occurred in Nahanni National Park Preserve - also know as the Valley of Headless Men - in the Northwest Territories, Canada. These stories are strange, not only because they are unexplained, but because the folklore of the region and even historical events do suggest that something strange is going on in the valley. Is it something paranormal? An uncontacted tribe? A serial killer? Or simply bad luck? item.title: Horned Beasts of the North | Leshy and Wendigo | Podcast Episode 57
item.description: It is a common theme of European folklore that the beings which inhabit forests bear some resemblence to the stag. Be it the Leshy, the Europeanized Wendigo, or the Horned God Cernunnos, what drives us to depict some creatures in this way? We dive into the history of the Horned Beast, and the many iterations that we have seen. item.title: What Happened to Stacy Arras? | Missing 411 | Podcast Episode 55
item.description: The disappearance of Stacy Arras is one of the more intriguing Missing 411 cases. Not because it is so baffling or inexplicable, but because it was handled in so strange a manner. Stacy's last words with her father, her choice of companion, and especially records of the incident, make no sense. Furthermore, the Department of the Interior maintains that this is an ongoing matter, despite the fact that it is not currently under any investigation. Is David Paulides being stonewalled, or do the accusations of his dishonesty hold water? item.title: Tom Messick is on a Hunting Trip... | Missing 411 | Podcast Episode 53
item.description: Tom Messick is out on a hunting trip, and he hasn't been home in a few days...2,436 days, to be exact. We covered the disappearance of Tom Messick for our very first episode of Into Thin Air, and there was quite a bit to uncover. We're breaking down our trip, what we learned, what was left out of the original story, and what is beginning to feel like a plausible theory regarding the Missing 411 phenomenon, or at least some of the cases: feral people. item.title: Devil Went Down to Edom... | Book of Job | The Lore Lodge: Episode 52
item.description: In the Book of Job, the Devil went down to Edom, he was looking for a soul to steal...from God. Often cited as a story of God's cruelty and indifference, Job is, in reality, far more complex than that. Possibly a compilation of an old Jewish story and later Greek influenced philosophical dialogue, the book details the trials of the most righteous man of the day, the wealthy and successful Job. Satan is  invited to tempt God's greatest servant, only to fail in breaking his faith. Aidan and Isaiah go deep into how this story of loss is really the story of salvation and growth in character.  Subscribe on Patreon to support The Lore Lodge for just $1 per month! https://patreon.com/thelorelodge Follow us in other places via https://aidanmattis.carrd.co Discord: https://discord.gg/233tjGj46z Shop at Target and support The Lore Lodge at https://goto.target.com/lorelodge Shop sustainable products at https://www.gaiaindustrees.com/ using code "LORE"

item.title: The Brian Laundrie Confession | Podcast Episode 51
item.description: I have some thoughts on the confession of Brian Laundrie. In September of 2021, I received a snapchat message from one of my followers, asking if I could post about his sister, Gabby Petito, who had gone missing a couple of days prior. She was hiking with her boyfriend, Brian Laundrie. I immediately posted about it, using the story given to me by her younger brother, TJ. There were, at the time of posting, four videos using the hashtag I was asked to use. To say that the events which followed shocked me is an understatement. Within a week it was national news. It was not long, of course, before Brian himself went missing from his family home in Florida. The Laundries lawyered up and refused to cooperate, before eventually injecting themselves into the search effort and immediately finding what they claimed were the remains of their son. We posted a video, linked below, on October 23rd, giving our thoughts on the story to that point. With the release of "Brian's" confession, obtained from the FBI by the Laundrie family's lawyer, Steven Bertolino, I feel it is time to revisit things and give my opinion on the case once again.   Everything stated in this video is my own opinion, and does not reflect the opinion of the Petito family, their lawyers, or anyone else involved in the ongoing lawsuit. I speak on this topic with the permission of the Petito family.  Our initial video on this case: https://youtu.be/EuTUuoAAOLI To assist current and future domestic abuse victims in getting the help they need, please donate via https://gabbypetitofoundation.org/ Subscribe on Patreon to support The Lore Lodge for just $1 per month! https://patreon.com/thelorelodge Follow us in other places via https://aidanmattis.carrd.co Discord: https://discord.gg/233tjGj46z Shop at Target and support The Lore Lodge at https://goto.target.com/lorelodge Shop sustainable products at https://www.gaiaindustrees.com/ using code "LORE"

item.title: Sons of God with Inspiring Philosophy | Podcast Episode 50
item.description: The story of Noah's Ark is one of the best known stories of the Bible, but are we taught the correct version? What of the "Sons of God" and the children they created with the "Daughters or Men"? Is the narrative we all heard in Sunday School really how the author of Genesis meant for us to believe, or were the "nephilim" deliberately obscured from our understanding? We're joined by  @InspiringPhilosophy  to discuss this and other biblical topics.  Subscribe on Patreon to support The Lore Lodge for just $1 per month! https://patreon.com/thelorelodge Follow us in other places via https://aidanmattis.carrd.co Discord: https://discord.gg/233tjGj46z Shop at Target and support The Lore Lodge at https://goto.target.com/lorelodge Shop sustainable products at https://www.gaiaindustrees.com/ using code "LORE"

item.title: Origins of Folktales | Cultural Anthropology | Episode 47
item.description: We often are confronted with legends and folktales that appear to us as otherworldly, but in many cases, the origins of these stories can be found in very real phenomena. Changelings, once thought to be replacement children left behind by the Fae, likely were an early explanation for autism and other social challenges. The Uncanny Valley may be the result of an ancient cousin of ours, which terrified our ancestors to the core. item.title: Missing 411 | The Case of Aaron Hedges | The Lore Lodge: Episode 43
item.description:
One of the most inexplicable and haunting Missing 411 cases is that of Aaron Hedges. In the Crazy Mountains of Montana, 38 year old Aaron disappeared - with a trace. Despite leaving a trail of clues, Hedges was never found. Aaron has since become known as "the hunter who vanished in the crazies", with even the most seasoned investigators remaining baffled by his unlikely disappearance. item.title: Who are the FAE? with Piper CJ | The Lore Lodge Official Podcast Episode 41
item.description:
If you come from a northern European culture, you've likely heard of the Fae. Today, the term is very broad, referring to all manner of fairies, elves, goblins, and more. But it wasn't always this way. Tonight, we sit down with best-selling author Piper CJ to discuss the Fair Folk, the similarities between folk tales of the Celtic, Germanic, and Greco-Roman traditions, and the controversy surrounding Piper's first novel. Welcome back to The Lore Lodge...

item.title: The Lost Colony of Roanoke | The Lore Lodge Podcast: Episode 37
item.description:
At the dawn of American colonization, a colony was twice attempted at Roanoke Island. In both cases, the attempt failed, and the colonies were lost. The first time, we have record of conflict with the natives and trouble securing food. The second time the colony vanished, however, is shrouded in mystery, with one word hanging over it all: Croatoan. Welcome back to The Lore Lodge...

item.title: The Valley of Headless Men | The Lore Lodge: Episode 29
item.description:
The boys discuss The Valley of Headless Men, Missing 411, and the idea of uncontacted tribes in our national parks.

Centering around Nahanni National Park Preserve in Canada, this is the tale of a number of unexplained deaths - most of them men discovered headless - in the Nahanni River Valley. For decades in the late 19th and early 20th centuries, a mysterious force claimed the lives of over a dozen men who went into the region to prospect, hunt, or settle.  

Welcome back to The Lore Lodge...  

Support The Lore Lodge via Patreon at https://patreon.com/thelorelodge  

Discord link: https://discord.gg/thelorelodge
